segments.en: Hello everyone and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine and we're here talking about some special foods today.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要谈论一些特别的食物。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we're going to talk about seafood.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论海鲜。

segments.en: So everything that comes from the sea that we eat.
segments.cn: 所以我们吃的所有来自海洋的东西。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we're in a restaurant and we're going to hear about the different options this restaurant offers.
segments.cn: 我们在一家餐厅，接下来我们将听听这家餐厅提供的不同选择。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听对话。

segments.en: This is such a nice restaurant.
segments.cn: 这是一家很不错的餐厅。

segments.en: I feel so classy.
segments.cn: 我感觉很高档。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a little bit pricey but they serve the best seafood in town.
segments.cn: 是的，有点贵，但他们提供城里最好的海鲜。

segments.en: May I take your order?
segments.cn: 请问我可以为您点餐吗？

segments.en: Yes, I would like some marinated grilled shrimp for starters and I'll also have the lobster.
segments.cn: 是的，我想要一些腌制的烤虾作为开胃菜，我还要龙虾。

segments.en: Excellent choice sir.
segments.cn: 很好的选择，先生。

segments.en: And for you madame?
segments.cn: 那您呢，女士？

segments.en: I would like the baked oysters and the seafood platter.
segments.cn: 我想要烤牡蛎和海鲜拼盘。

segments.en: Very good madame.
segments.cn: 非常好，女士。

segments.en: That seafood platter sounds good.
segments.cn: 那个海鲜拼盘听起来不错。

segments.en: Excuse me, what does the platter have?
segments.cn: 劳驾，拼盘里有什么？

segments.en: It's a great combination of clams, scallops, mussels, calamari and filet of salmon and tuna.
segments.cn: 这是一个很棒的组合，包括蛤蜊、扇贝、贻贝、鱿鱼和三文鱼与金枪鱼的鱼片。

segments.en: It comes with a side of butter sauce and French fries.
segments.cn: 它配有黄油酱和薯条。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Cancel the lobster and give me one of the same please.
segments.cn: 取消龙虾，给我一个相同的拼盘。

segments.en: Very well sir.
segments.cn: 非常好，先生。

segments.en: Anything to drink?
segments.cn: 需要喝点什么吗？

segments.en: Can we get a bottle of your house wiped wine please?
segments.cn: 我们可以要一瓶你们的家酿白酒吗？

segments.en: Superb choice.
segments.cn: 极好的选择。

segments.en: I will be back shortly with the wine.
segments.cn: 我会很快带来酒。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So today we're going to take a look at a lot of vocabs.
segments.cn: 今天我们将学习很多词汇。

segments.en: So we're going to have two parts of language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们将有两个部分的语言学习。

segments.en: And let's start with the first one.
segments.cn: 让我们从第一部分开始。

segments.en: Now in language takeaway part one today we have a number of really important and useful adjectives.
segments.cn: 在今天的语言学习第一部分，我们有一些非常重要和实用的形容词。

segments.en: The first one is classy.
segments.cn: 第一个是高档。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we're going to a nice restaurant and so you feel like you're in a classy place.
segments.cn: 所以我们去一家不错的餐厅，你会觉得自己在一个高档的地方。

segments.en: Now a classy place is a nice place.
segments.cn: 高档的地方是一个不错的地方。

segments.en: You might be expected to dress nicely.
segments.cn: 你可能需要穿得体面一些。

segments.en: It might be a little bit fancy.
segments.cn: 可能会有点奢华。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So classy is kind of a synonym of fancy or luxurious.
segments.cn: 所以高档是奢华或豪华的同义词。

segments.en: Right, so if you're going on a date with someone it might be a good idea to go to a classy restaurant.
segments.cn: 对，如果你和某人约会，去一家高档餐厅可能是个好主意。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But usually if a restaurant is classy it also means that it's a little bit pricey.
segments.cn: 但通常如果一家餐厅是高档的，也意味着它有点贵。

segments.en: Okay, so something that is pricey is expensive.
segments.cn: 好的，贵的东西就是昂贵的。

segments.en: And seafood is famous in America for being very pricey.
segments.cn: 海鲜在美国因其昂贵而闻名。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So something that is pricey means that it's a little bit expensive.
segments.cn: 所以贵的东西意味着它有点昂贵。

segments.en: Now going to the food that we're going to get today we had a couple of different ways of describing how the food was prepared.
segments.cn: 现在谈到我们今天要吃的食物，我们有几种不同的方式来描述食物的准备方式。

segments.en: So for example the first one is marinated grilled shrimp.
segments.cn: 例如，第一个是腌制的烤虾。

segments.en: Alright, now something that is marinated is covered in a sauce or a liquid before it's cooked.
segments.cn: 好的，腌制的东西是在烹饪前用酱汁或液体覆盖的。

segments.en: Alright, so you can have maybe a regular steak but you can also have a marinated steak which would be marinated in some kind of flavor.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以有一块普通的牛排，但你也可以有一块腌制的牛排，腌制在某种调味料中。

segments.en: Like garlic or yogurt.
segments.cn: 比如大蒜或酸奶。

segments.en: That's right, so usually you leave it in maybe some sauce like garlic sauce for a couple of hours or a couple of minutes before you cook it.
segments.cn: 没错，通常你会把它放在大蒜酱中几个小时或几分钟，然后再烹饪。

segments.en: Now when we cook it there are different ways of cooking things.
segments.cn: 现在当我们烹饪时，有不同的烹饪方式。

segments.en: In this case we're having grilled shrimp.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们吃的是烤虾。

segments.en: Alright, now grilled is different from fried.
segments.cn: 好的，烤和炸是不同的。

segments.en: Fried we do in a pan with some oil.
segments.cn: 炸是用油在平底锅中进行的。

segments.en: But a grill usually there's no pan, no oil.
segments.cn: 但烤通常没有平底锅，没有油。

segments.en: There's just a grill.
segments.cn: 只有一个烤架。

segments.en: So grill, grilled.
segments.cn: 所以烤，烤的食物。

segments.en: Grill is the tool that we use.
segments.cn: 烤是我们使用的工具。

segments.en: Grilled food tends to be quite healthy.
segments.cn: 烤的食物通常比较健康。

segments.en: There's very little oil.
segments.cn: 油很少。

segments.en: It's a bit more dry.
segments.cn: 有点干。

segments.en: And often times we do grilling outside because there's lots of smoke.
segments.cn: 而且我们通常在户外烤，因为会有很多烟。

segments.en: That's right, because usually you have like maybe a barbecue and you have some charcoal in there or some wood.
segments.cn: 没错，因为通常你会有一个烧烤架，里面有一些木炭或木头。

segments.en: That's what you use to cook the food with.
segments.cn: 这就是你用来烹饪食物的。

segments.en: Yeah, and grilled food is very easy to notice because there are usually black lines on top and bottom.
segments.cn: 是的，烤的食物很容易辨认，因为上面和下面通常有黑线。

segments.en: That's from the grill.
segments.cn: 那是来自烤架的。

segments.en: That's right, so we ordered marinated grilled shrimp for starters.
segments.cn: 没错，所以我们点了腌制的烤虾作为开胃菜。

segments.en: So what is a starter?
segments.cn: 那么什么是开胃菜？

segments.en: Well, think about the word starter.
segments.cn: 嗯，想想开胃菜这个词。

segments.en: Start.
segments.cn: 开始。

segments.en: Now a starter is something you eat at the start of your meal, at the beginning.
segments.cn: 开胃菜是在你用餐开始时吃的东西，在开始时。

segments.en: You eat it before you eat the main course.
segments.cn: 你在吃主菜之前吃它。

segments.en: Alright, so it's also known as an appetizer.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它也被称为开胃小菜。

segments.en: That's right, starters and appetizers are the same thing.
segments.cn: 没错，开胃菜和开胃小菜是一样的。

segments.en: And these are small things you eat before you start to eat your main meal.
segments.cn: 这些是你在开始吃主餐之前吃的小东西。

segments.en: So they're not very filling.
segments.cn: 所以它们不会很饱。

segments.en: Okay, so yeah, it'll be something small like a soup or maybe like in this case some marinated grilled shrimp.
segments.cn: 好的，所以是的，它会是一些小东西，比如汤，或者像在这种情况下的腌制烤虾。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Alright, so great vocab there.
segments.cn: 好的，词汇很棒。

segments.en: Why don't we review that part and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不复习一下那部分，然后我们稍后再回来。

segments.en: This is such a nice restaurant.
segments.cn: 这是一家很不错的餐厅。

segments.en: I feel so classy.
segments.cn: 我感觉很高档。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a little bit pricey but they serve the best seafood in town.
segments.cn: 是的，有点贵，但他们提供城里最好的海鲜。

segments.en: May I take your order?
segments.cn: 请问我可以为您点餐吗？

segments.en: Yes, I would like some marinated grilled shrimp for starters and I'll also have the lobster.
segments.cn: 是的，我想要一些腌制的烤虾作为开胃菜，我还要龙虾。

segments.en: Excellent choice, sir.
segments.cn: 很好的选择，先生。

segments.en: And for you, madame?
segments.cn: 那您呢，女士？

segments.en: I would like the baked oysters and the seafood platter.
segments.cn: 我想要烤牡蛎和海鲜拼盘。

segments.en: Very good, madame.
segments.cn: 非常好，女士。

segments.en: That seafood platter sounds good.
segments.cn: 那个海鲜拼盘听起来不错。

segments.en: Excuse me, what does the platter have?
segments.cn: 劳驾，拼盘里有什么？

segments.en: It's a great combination of clams, scallops, mussels, calamari and filet of salmon and tuna.
segments.cn: 这是一个很棒的组合，包括蛤蜊、扇贝、贻贝、鱿鱼和三文鱼与金枪鱼的鱼片。

segments.en: It comes with a side of butter sauce and French fries.
segments.cn: 它配有黄油酱和薯条。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Cancel the lobster and give me one of the same, please.
segments.cn: 取消龙虾，给我一个相同的拼盘。

segments.en: Very well, sir.
segments.cn: 非常好，先生。

segments.en: Anything to drink?
segments.cn: 需要喝点什么吗？

segments.en: Can we get a bottle of your house wipe wine, please?
segments.cn: 请给我们一瓶你们的招牌白酒。

segments.en: Superb choice.
segments.cn: 极好的选择。

segments.en: I will be back shortly with the wine.
segments.cn: 我马上就回来，带酒过来。

segments.en: Alright, so now let's take a look at all the exquisite types of seafood that we have here on Language Takeaway Part 2.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看在语言外卖第二部分中所有精致的海鲜。

segments.en: Alright, now the first thing we have in Language Takeaway Part 2 is a very distinctive animal from the ocean.
segments.cn: 好的，语言外卖第二部分中的第一种是来自海洋的一种非常独特的动物。

segments.en: It's bright red and it has two claws.
segments.cn: 它鲜红色，有两个爪子。

segments.en: Right, we're talking about a lobster.
segments.cn: 对，我们说的是龙虾。

segments.en: Now, lobsters you don't find everywhere.
segments.cn: 龙虾并不是随处可见。

segments.en: In fact, there are some parts of America where they're very famous for their lobster, like Maine.
segments.cn: 事实上，美国有些地方以龙虾而闻名，比如缅因州。

segments.en: Now, these are animals that are hard on the outside and soft and white on the inside and they're quite difficult to eat.
segments.cn: 这些动物外壳坚硬，内部柔软洁白，吃起来相当困难。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, they look kind of like crabs because they also have the claws and everything, but they're a lot longer, right?
segments.cn: 它们看起来有点像螃蟹，因为它们也有爪子，但它们更长，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, a crab is round and a lobster is long.
segments.cn: 没错，螃蟹是圆的，龙虾是长的。

segments.en: And lobsters are also famous for one part, for their tails.
segments.cn: 龙虾还因其尾巴而闻名。

segments.en: Right, the tails are full of meat.
segments.cn: 对，尾巴肉多。

segments.en: They're very delicate, very delicious.
segments.cn: 非常细腻，非常美味。

segments.en: Okay, so we're having some lobster and we also ordered some baked oysters.
segments.cn: 好的，我们点了龙虾，还点了烤生蚝。

segments.en: Now, oysters are another kind of thing that comes from the ocean.
segments.cn: 现在，生蚝是另一种来自海洋的东西。

segments.en: They come in a shell, alright?
segments.cn: 它们有壳，对吧？

segments.en: And you might hear about oysters because some people, some restaurants like to have an oyster bar where they serve raw oysters over ice.
segments.cn: 你可能听说过生蚝，因为有些人和餐厅喜欢设立生蚝吧，提供生蚝冰镇食用。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, they look like big rocks, basically.
segments.cn: 所以，它们看起来像大石头。

segments.en: And when you open them inside, you have meat.
segments.cn: 打开后，里面有肉。

segments.en: And actually, I think you get pearls from oysters, right?
segments.cn: 其实，我想你可以从生蚝中得到珍珠，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, these two are special.
segments.cn: 所以，这两者是特别的。

segments.en: They have a nice relationship.
segments.cn: 它们之间有很好的关系。

segments.en: The Pearl forms inside, grows inside of the oyster.
segments.cn: 珍珠在生蚝内部形成并生长。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So, now we've taken a look at some oysters and talking about these things that have shells.
segments.cn: 现在我们已经看过一些生蚝，谈论这些有壳的东西。

segments.en: We also have clams.
segments.cn: 我们还有蛤蜊。

segments.en: Now, while oysters are big and sometimes quite shiny, clams are smaller, usually white or gray.
segments.cn: 现在，虽然生蚝大且有时相当闪亮，蛤蜊则较小，通常是白色或灰色。

segments.en: And they have lines on them and they're shells that you open up and you eat the meat from inside.
segments.cn: 它们有条纹，壳可以打开，里面有肉。

segments.en: Right, so I guess if you've ever been on the beach and you're collecting little seashells, usually those are kind of like clams.
segments.cn: 对，所以我想如果你曾经在海滩上收集小贝壳，通常那些就像蛤蜊。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: They're quite small.
segments.cn: 它们相当小。

segments.en: They can be about the size of an American quarter, 25 cents.
segments.cn: 大约和美国的25美分硬币差不多大。

segments.en: Okay, so now in this seafood platter that we're ordering, we have clams, we have scallops.
segments.cn: 好的，现在在我们点的海鲜拼盘中，我们有蛤蜊，还有扇贝。

segments.en: Ooh, scallops are one of my favorite kinds of seafood.
segments.cn: 哦，扇贝是我最喜欢的海鲜之一。

segments.en: They're quite soft and chewy.
segments.cn: 它们相当柔软且有嚼劲。

segments.en: And they're usually white.
segments.cn: 通常是白色的。

segments.en: Okay, and then we have some mussels also.
segments.cn: 好的，然后我们还有一些贻贝。

segments.en: Now, mussels are much different looking.
segments.cn: 现在，贻贝的外观非常不同。

segments.en: They're also in shells, but they're long and the shells are black.
segments.cn: 它们也有壳，但它们是长的，壳是黑色的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, clams are kind of small and round.
segments.cn: 所以，蛤蜊是小而圆的。

segments.en: The oysters are pretty big and look like rocks.
segments.cn: 生蚝则相当大，看起来像石头。

segments.en: Mussels, on the other hand, are long and black.
segments.cn: 而贻贝则是长的黑色。

segments.en: And when you open them inside, they're shiny also.
segments.cn: 打开后，里面也很光滑。

segments.en: They're orange on the inside, or yellow, and so they're quite interesting looking.
segments.cn: 它们内部是橙色或黄色，看起来相当有趣。

segments.en: But they're also very famous for the French, or Belgian rather, the Belgian dish moule frites, which is a nice specialty.
segments.cn: 但它们也因比利时菜肴“贻贝薯条”而闻名，这是一道很好的特色菜。

segments.en: Alright, and lastly, we are also having some calamari in this seafood platter.
segments.cn: 好的，最后我们在这个海鲜拼盘中还会有一些鱿鱼。

segments.en: Ooh, this is another one of my favorites.
segments.cn: 哦，这是我另一个最喜欢的。

segments.en: Now, calamari is a kind of food, but the animal is the squid.
segments.cn: 鱿鱼是一种食物，但动物是鱿鱼。

segments.en: Okay, so why is it called calamari?
segments.cn: 好的，为什么叫鱿鱼？

segments.en: Well, calamari, I believe, comes from the Italian word calamaro.
segments.cn: 嗯，我相信鱿鱼这个词来自意大利语“calamaro”。

segments.en: Calamari means that it's squid that's been cooked so that people can eat it.
segments.cn: 鱿鱼意味着已经烹饪好的鱿鱼，供人们食用。

segments.en: Okay, so basically calamari and squid are the same thing.
segments.cn: 好的，所以基本上鱿鱼和鱿鱼是同一种东西。

segments.en: They are the same animal, but calamari means that it's prepared to eat.
segments.cn: 它们是同一种动物，但鱿鱼意味着它是准备好吃的。

segments.en: Yes, and usually it's fried, so when squid is fried, it becomes hard, chewy.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是油炸的，所以当鱿鱼被油炸时，它变得坚硬，有嚼劲。

segments.en: And that's what calamari tastes like.
segments.cn: 这就是鱿鱼的味道。

segments.en: It's quite chewy.
segments.cn: 它相当有嚼劲。

segments.en: Alright, great stuff, so why don't we review everything one last time with this exquisite lesson.
segments.cn: 好的，太棒了，所以我们最后再复习一下这一堂精致的课。

segments.en: This is such a nice restaurant.
segments.cn: 这是一家很好的餐厅。

segments.en: I feel so classy.
segments.cn: 我感觉很高档。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a little bit pricey, but they serve the best seafood in town.
segments.cn: 是的，价格有点贵，但他们提供城里最好的海鲜。

segments.en: May I take your order?
segments.cn: 我可以为您点餐吗？

segments.en: Yes, I would like some marinated grilled shrimp for starters, and I'll also have the lobster.
segments.cn: 是的，我想要一些腌制的烤虾作为开胃菜，我还要龙虾。

segments.en: Excellent choice, sir.
segments.cn: 极好的选择，先生。

segments.en: And for you, madame?
segments.cn: 那您呢，女士？

segments.en: I would like the baked oysters and the seafood platter.
segments.cn: 我想要烤生蚝和海鲜拼盘。

segments.en: Very good, madame.
segments.cn: 非常好，女士。

segments.en: That seafood platter sounds good.
segments.cn: 那个海鲜拼盘听起来不错。

segments.en: Excuse me, what does the platter have?
segments.cn: 劳驾，拼盘里有什么？

segments.en: It's a great combination of clams, scallops, mussels, calamari, and fillet of salmon and tuna.
segments.cn: 这是蛤蜊、扇贝、贻贝、鱿鱼，以及三文鱼和金枪鱼的组合。

segments.en: It comes with a side of butter sauce and French fries.
segments.cn: 还配有黄油酱和薯条。

segments.en: That sounds great.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Cancel the lobster and give me one of the same, please.
segments.cn: 取消龙虾，给我一个同样的拼盘。

segments.en: Very well, sir.
segments.cn: 非常好，先生。

segments.en: Anything to drink?
segments.cn: 需要喝点什么吗？

segments.en: Can we get a bottle of your house-wiped wine, please?
segments.cn: 请给我们一瓶你们的招牌白酒。

segments.en: Superb choice.
segments.cn: 极好的选择。

segments.en: I will be back shortly with the wine.
segments.cn: 我马上就回来，带酒过来。

segments.en: All right, so seafood, we said, usually has the connotation of being a little bit pricey.
segments.cn: 好的，所以海鲜，我们说，通常意味着价格有点贵。

segments.en: Why do you think that is?
segments.cn: 你认为这是为什么？

segments.en: I think it's pricey because the best seafood doesn't come from seafood farms.
segments.cn: 我认为贵是因为最好的海鲜并不是来自海鲜养殖场。

segments.en: It comes from people who go in boats and they collect the seafood in nets.
segments.cn: 它来自那些乘船出海，用网捕捞海鲜的人。

segments.en: And also, there are fewer and fewer places now in America where you can find this kind of food because some places have experienced overfishing.
segments.cn: 而且，现在美国能找到这种食物的地方越来越少，因为有些地方经历了过度捕捞。

segments.en: Too many people are trying to fish.
segments.cn: 太多人在捕鱼。

segments.en: And also, some places just don't have the right climate for certain animals.
segments.cn: 而且，有些地方根本没有适合某些动物的气候。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, for example, in the United States, you do have...
segments.cn: 例如，在美国，你确实有...

segments.en: Well, the whole country is covered in the West Coast by the Pacific Ocean.
segments.cn: 嗯，整个国家的西海岸被太平洋覆盖。

segments.en: The East Coast, you have the Atlantic.
segments.cn: 东海岸则是大西洋。

segments.en: So, obviously, you do have some coasts.
segments.cn: 所以，显然，你确实有一些海岸。

segments.en: But if you're in the middle of the United States, it's probably hard to get seafood.
segments.cn: 但如果你在美国中部，可能很难找到海鲜。

segments.en: So, I imagine it's very expensive.
segments.cn: 所以，我想这非常昂贵。

segments.en: It can be very, very expensive.
segments.cn: 可能非常非常昂贵。

segments.en: So, oftentimes, we get lake food.
segments.cn: 所以，很多时候，我们吃湖里的食物。

segments.en: It's different kind of fish, but we don't have lobsters.
segments.cn: 这是不同种类的鱼，但我们没有龙虾。

segments.en: But you'll find that in the West, you get very good salmon because Alaska in the Northwest is very famous for salmon from the Pacific.
segments.cn: 但你会发现，在西部，你能吃到非常好的三文鱼，因为阿拉斯加在西北部以太平洋的三文鱼而闻名。

segments.en: And in the East, it's very famous for lobster and crab, which are delicious.
segments.cn: 而在东部，它以龙虾和螃蟹而闻名，这些都很美味。

segments.en: Now, even though it's famous for lobster and crab, it's still relatively expensive compared to other dishes.
segments.cn: 现在，尽管它以龙虾和螃蟹而闻名，但与其他菜肴相比，仍然相对昂贵。

segments.en: Like, for example, I think a lobster... How much would a lobster dinner cost?
segments.cn: 比如，我想一顿龙虾晚餐... 多少钱呢？

segments.en: A lobster dinner could cost you $150.
segments.cn: 一顿龙虾晚餐可能要150美元。

segments.en: Right, and you're getting almost the same amount of meat as maybe having a steak that would be $20.
segments.cn: 对，几乎得到的肉量和一块20美元的牛排差不多。

segments.en: Yeah, less meat, I think.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得肉更少。

segments.en: But we have more cows than we have lobsters.
segments.cn: 但我们养的牛比龙虾多。

segments.en: And also, lobsters are famous for being pretty expensive.
segments.cn: 而且，龙虾以相当昂贵而闻名。

segments.en: It's a very fancy meal to have lobsters.
segments.cn: 吃龙虾是一顿非常奢华的餐。

segments.en: So, it's very interesting.
segments.cn: 所以，这非常有趣。

segments.en: And actually, some countries...
segments.cn: 其实，一些国家...

segments.en: So, it's very interesting, but some countries, seafood is very, very inexpensive.
segments.cn: 所以，这非常有趣，但一些国家，海鲜非常非常便宜。

segments.en: Some communities or some countries or communities that fish or have, for example, shrimp farms, it's very inexpensive.
segments.cn: 一些社区或一些国家或社区，捕鱼或有，比如说，虾养殖场，海鲜非常便宜。

segments.en: So, it's such a treat to be able to go there and have seafood all you want and not have to spend $300 on a meal.
segments.cn: 所以，能够去那里随便吃海鲜而不必花300美元吃一顿饭，真是太好了。

segments.en: It is indeed.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: And it's really nice to be able to get these big prawns, these big shrimp or lobsters and eat them without worrying about the price.
segments.cn: 能够吃到这些大虾、大龙虾而不必担心价格，真的很好。

segments.en: But I'm curious, in your country, do you have seafood?
segments.cn: 但我很好奇，在你的国家，你们有海鲜吗？

segments.en: And if so, what kind?
segments.cn: 如果有，是什么种类？

segments.en: Is it cheap?
segments.cn: 便宜吗？

segments.en: Is it expensive?
segments.cn: 贵吗？

segments.en: Is it pricey?
segments.cn: 昂贵吗？

segments.en: Let us know.
segments.cn: 让我们知道。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在那里见。
